CARDINAL . ORG Although it is in various respects regulated by legislation , the profession of avocat in GPE is a liberal profession ; under LAW , " avocats exercise their profession freely in the interests of justice and truth " .

CARDINAL . ORG In each of the country ’s CARDINAL judicial districts , there is an ORG ; it is independent of the executive and endowed with legal personality in public law and its ORG takes decisions " without appeal " with regard to entry on the register of avocats and admission to pupillage ( Articles CARDINAL and CARDINAL of the Judicial Code ) .

A pupillage normally lasting DATE is a pre - requisite to entry on the register of avocats ( LAW and the second paragraph of ORG CARDINAL and CARDINAL ) . Subject to the powers of ORG , ORG determines the obligations of pupils ( ORG CARDINAL and CARDINAL ) . In the main these consist of attending at a pupil - master ’s chambers , attending hearings , following courses on the rules of professional conduct and the art of advocacy ( Article CARDINAL , third paragraph ) and acting as defence counsel in cases assigned by ORG ( Article CARDINAL ) . ORG ensures that these obligations are complied with and may , if need be , prolong the pupillage " without prejudice to the right to refuse entry on the register " ; any pupil who is unable , after DATE at the latest , to show that he or she has satisfied the said obligations " may be omitted from the roll " of pupils ( Article CARDINAL , second and fourth paragraphs ) .

Pupils in principle enjoy the same rights as their colleagues who are already entered on the register of avocats . However , they may not plead before ORG or the ORG d’État ( LAW ) , vote in elections of the chairman or other members of ORG ) or deputise for judges and members of the public prosecutor ’s department .

ORG In the oath that he takes at the end of his pupillage , the avocat undertakes , amongst other things , not to advise or appear in any case which he does not consider to the best of his knowledge and belief to be just ( LAW Subject to the exceptions provided for by law , for example in LAW and LAW , avocats - including pupil avocats - enjoy an exclusive right of audience before the courts ( LAW ) . The Council of the Ordre sanctions or punishes as a disciplinary matter offences and misconduct , without prejudice , where appropriate , to proceedings before the courts ( Article CARDINAL , first paragraph ) . It will hear disciplinary cases on application made by its chairman , either of his own motion or following a complaint or after a written notification from the procureur général ( public prosecutor ) ( Article CARDINAL ) . The ORG may , depending on the circumstances , warn , censure , reprimand , suspend for a maximum of DATE or strike a name off the register of avocats or the roll of pupils ( LAW ) .

Both the avocat concerned and the procureur général may challenge such a decision - finding the avocat guilty or not guilty - by applying to the competent disciplinary appeal board ( Articles CARDINAL and CARDINAL ) . The disciplinary appeal board is composed of a chairman ( who is the first president of ORG or a president of a chamber delegated by him ) , CARDINAL assessors ( who are avocats ) and a secretary ( who is a member or former member of ORG ) ; the procureur général or a judicial officer from his department delegated by him fulfils the functions of prosecuting authority ( Articles CARDINAL and CARDINAL ) .
The avocat concerned or the procureur général may refer the decision of the disciplinary appeal board to ORG ( Article CARDINAL ) .

CARDINAL . ORG In GPE , as in many other GPE , there exists a long tradition that the Bar should provide legal representation , if need be on a free basis , for indigent persons . At the time of the relevant facts , ORG was under a duty to make provision for " the assistance of persons of insufficient means " by setting up a " ORG " in such manner as it should determine ( Article CARDINAL , first paragraph , of LAW ) . " Obviously ill - founded cases [ were not to ] be allocated " ( second paragraph of the same Article ) , but in criminal matters ORG had to make an officially appointed - or " pro PERSON " - avocat available to any indigent accused who so requested DATE before the hearing ( LAW ) .

Officially appointed avocats were thus designated by the ORG by virtue of a statutory competence conferred by the ORG . In GPE and GPE a system of rotation was used whereas in GPE the matter was dealt with on a more flexible basis . The ORG almost always selected pupil avocats who , if need be , had to continue acting in the case even after the end of their pupillage , as occurred in the present circumstances ( see paragraph CARDINAL above ) . It nonetheless happened - in less than one per cent of the cases - that a difficult case was entrusted to a more experienced avocat .

ORG Under the third paragraph of LAW , pupil avocats were required to " report to the [ ORG on the steps they [ had ] taken in the cases entrusted to them " ; such cases accounted on average for DATE of their working time , especially during DATE . The ORG des avocats would decline to enter a pupil avocat on the register unless he had acted as officially appointed avocat on a sufficient number of occasions ; ORG enjoyed considerable discretion in the matter since no minimum or maximum was laid down in its pupillage regulations .

Pupil avocats could invoke the so - called " conscience clause " laid down in LAW ( see paragraph CARDINAL above ) or objective grounds of incompatibility . In the event of an unjustified refusal to deal with cases that the ORG wished to allocate to him , ORG could extend the pupillage of a pupil avocat to a maximum period of DATE , strike his name off the roll of pupils or refuse his application for entry on the register of avocats for failure to perform fully his obligations ( Article CARDINAL , second and fourth paragraphs ) .

ORG The position described in the preceding paragraph has changed in CARDINAL respect subsequent to the end of the applicant ’s pupillage : an Act of DATE " intended to furnish a partial solution to the problem of legal aid and regulating the remuneration of pupil avocats appointed to provide legal aid " has amended LAW by , inter alia , inserting the following provisions :
